intro: Hoffmannseggia lactea, commonly known as the milkweed of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and has a succulent appearance to store water. Hoffmannseggia lactea is often found in rocky or arid habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
